app_desc.message: Additional functionality for your cycling and running analysis.  This extension upgrades the Strava™ website.

analysis_elapsed_power_tooltip.message: Average elapsed power: Stops are zero padded

analysis_elapsed_pace_tooltip.message: Average elapsed pace: Stops are included in the time span

analysis_gap_tooltip.message: Grade Adjusted Pace: Estimated pace for flat terrain

analysis_np_tooltip.message: Normalized Power®: An estimate of potential average power

analysis_xp_tooltip.message: xPower: An improved potential power estimation inspired by Normalized Power® (created by Dr. Philip Friere Skiba)

analysis_sp_tooltip.message: Sea Power: An estimate of potential power at sea level

analysis_sp_adjust_tooltip.message: Compensation due to altitude's effect on V02Max

analysis_tss_tooltip.message: Training Stress Score®: A power based stress load indicator

analysis_trimp_tss_tooltip.message: TRIMP (TRaining IMPulse) based Training Stress Score®: A heart rate reserve based stress load indicator

analysis_start_of_effort_tooltip.message: Time offset to the start of this effort

analysis_wkg_tooltip.message: Watts per kilogram of body weight

analysis_ftp_input_tooltip.message: Enter the estimated FTP (Functional Threshold Power) for this athlete and press Enter.  FTP is the maximum watt average sustained for 1 hour.  If the athlete already has a value set in their profile then this will override that setting.  To reset the value enter a blank value.

analysis_weight_input_tooltip.message: Enter the estimated weight for this athlete and press Enter.  If the athlete already has a value set in their profile then this will override that setting.  To reset the value enter a blank value.

analysis_peak_power_wkg_tooltip.message: Maximum sustained watts/kg of body weight

analysis_peak_sp_tooltip.message: Maximum sea level adjusted power ranges

analysis_peak_gap_tooltip.message: Maximum sustained grade adjusted pace ranges

analysis_watt_estimate_tooltip.message: These values are being calculated from wattage estimates.  For accurate values a real power measurement device is required.

analysis_empty_info_aside.message: No segments or other data for this range.

analysis_overlap_tooltip.message: The amount of overlap on a segment.  100% means the entire segment was traversed.

analysis_power_profile_about1.message: The concept of power profiling was created by Dr. Andy Coggan.  It is a basic outline of the power requirements to be at a specific level of racing competitiveness.

analysis_power_profile_about2.message: These rankings are meant to give you a rough idea of how your best power output would compare to the maximum capability of other racers.   They are most representative when you are working very hard.

analysis_power_profile_select.message: Select a profile to view required power outputs

analysis_power_profile_footer_leadin.message:
NOTE: The Sauce algorithm is an enhanced interpretation of Andy's original concept. For efforts between 20 and 60 minutes, Normalized Power® is gradually used instead of actual power. After 1 hour, only NP® is used and a logarithmic endurance factor is applied to better model fatigue.

For additional information on the original profiles read

analysis_create_live_segment_tooltip.message:
Create a Live Segment file from this effort.
Compatible with most modern Garmin devices.

analysis_peaks_ranges_intro.message: You may customize the times and distances used for Peak Efforts calculations. Depending on the data type, time or distances values will be used.

perf_predictor_intro_help1.message: Performance predictor works best if you first tune the input parameters to match the original performance's time.  For example, if you were on a mountain bike, select the "MTB" bike option.  If there was a prevailing head wind during the effort, change the wind speed value to indicate the net wind impact and so on.

perf_predictor_intro_help2.message: Once values are properly tuned, the predicted performance should resemble the original performance within a small percentage.

perf_predictor_intro_help3.message: Now you can alter different parameters such as power, weight and aerodynamics to estimate what performance impact those changes might have.

perf_predictor_intro.message: Performance Predictor is a cycling power calculator that allows you to examine the impact of altered performance factors.

perf_predictor_intro_note.message: Change these parameters to see the estimated effect on performance.

perf_predictor_crr_help1.message: Make sure this setting matches your bike and terrain as closely as possible.  You can fine tune the rolling resistance directly by altering the "Crr" value.

perf_predictor_crr_help2.message: Use lower "Crr" values (less resistance) for faster tires with good road surfaces and higher values (more resistance) for heavier duty tires on rough surfaces, e.g. mountain biking.

perf_predictor_crr_bike_tooltip.message: Bike type for rolling resistance estimate (e.g Crr)

perf_predictor_crr_terrain_tooltip.message: Terrain type for rolling resistance estimate (e.g. Crr)

perf_predictor_cda_help1.message: "CdA" represents the aerodynamic drag of a rider and equipment.  It is technically the coefficient of drag multiplied by the frontal surface area.  Lower values are achieved by riding lower, using speed suits and using specialty equipment such as time trial bikes and disc wheels.

perf_predictor_cda_help_table_elite_tt.message: Elite level time trial equipment and aero positioning

perf_predictor_cda_help_table_good_tt.message: Good time trial equipment and aero positioning / Triathlon

perf_predictor_cda_help_table_road.message: Road bike racing positions / Bar drops to hoods

perf_predictor_cda_help_table_climbing.message: Road bike climbing positions / XC mountain biking

perf_predictor_cda_position_tooltip.message: Aerodynamic position on bike for CdA estimate

perf_predictor_cda_tooltip.message: Aerodynamic drag coefficient times frontal surface area

perf_predictor_gear_weight_tooltip.message: Weight of all gear and bike including water and clothes

perf_predictor_elevation_tooltip.message: The average elevation of the course

perf_predictor_wind_tooltip.message: The net wind speed against the rider or negative values for tail winds

perf_predictor_power_details_gravity_too.message: Power and work requirements to overcome gravity

perf_predictor_power_details_aero_toolti.message: Power and work requirements to overcome aerodynamic drag

perf_predictor_power_details_rr_tooltip.message: Power and work requirements to overcome rolling resistance

perf_predictor_drafting_tooltip.message: Select this option to model drafting effects

perf_predictor_riders_tooltip.message: Number of riders in this group

perf_predictor_power_variance_tooltip.message: The difference in power between the most difficult position and the easiest position.  Usually this is the power for the 1st and last positions.

perf_predictor_group_power_tooltip.message: The average power for all positions in this group

perf_predictor_rotating_tooltip.message: Select this option to model a group of riders changing positions during the effort

perf_predictor_work_tooltip.message: Select the percentage of time in the first position of this group

perf_predictor_drafting_help.message:
Drafting or riding in a group of riders provides significant aerodynamic benefits. Performance Predictor can model these effects by applying research from Thijs van Druenen and Bert Blocken.

Note that this algorithm works well for smaller sized groups in single file formations. Large pelotons of riders are subject to more complicated aerodynamic forces which are not properly addressed here.

sync_control_panel_intro.message: Activity sync imports all activity history to allow for improved training charts and performance analysis.

sync_control_panel_intro_help.message:
Synchronizing activities allows Sauce to provide analysis features not possible without historical data. This includes a new performance page, as well as extending existing pages, like Analysis, with insights about previous performances. It is a great feature for advanced athletes and coaches!

Synchronization works by importing raw activity data to you web browser's local database. This data is analyzed, indexed and stored for fast lookups later on. As always, Sauce does not use remote servers, so it is recommended to save backups with the "Export Data" button.

sync_control_panel_sync_recompute_toolti.message: Recompute the sync local data, i.e. TSS, NP, etc...

mutable_data_ftp_help.message: Sauce supports setting FTP values for any point in your history.  Depending on the date an activity took place on, the corresponding value will be used for any FTP based calculations, such as TSS.

mutable_data_weight_help.message: Sauce supports setting weight values for any point in your history.  Depending on the date an activity took place on, the corresponding value will be used for any weight based calculations.

mutable_data_peaks_periods_help.message: Time periods are used for efforts such as power, heart rate and cadence.

mutable_data_peaks_dists_help.message: Distances are used for efforts such as pace and grade-adjusted-pace.

live_segment_success_create_body1.message: Your live segment file should now be downloaded to your computer.

live_segment_success_create_body2.message: Mount your device to your computer via USB and copy this file to the "Garmin/NewFiles" folder.

live_segment_success_create_body3.message: Be sure to safely eject the device before disconnecting it.

live_segment_intro_help1.message: The Sauce Live Segment creator generates a segment file from any Strava activity.  The file created conforms to the FIT segment file open standard.  This file is compatible with supported Garmin devices and may be compatible with other devices that can support side loading of segment files.

live_segment_intro_help_side_loading_mor.message: More info on Garmin side loading can be found here.

live_segment_intro_help_note.message: NOTE: Wahoo devices do NOT support side loading segment files.

live_segment_intro1.message: Create a Live Segment file for use with

live_segment_intro_note.message: This will generate a FIT segment file that can be placed in the "Garmin/NewFiles" folder of your Garmin when you connect it to a computer via USB.

live_segment_segment_name_help.message: The segment name is how this segment appears on your device when you approach the starting location.

live_segment_speed_adjust_tooltip.message: Adjust the overall speed by some percentage

live_segment_beg1.message: Hi my name is Justin and I'm the author of Sauce,

live_segment_beg2.message: I'm working hard to make Sauce the best Strava upgrade possible, but without your support I can't dedicate the time and energy to make this possible.  Please consider becoming a patron to enable this feature and get the full Sauce experience.

live_segment_beg3.message: Thank you so much for understanding and contributing to making Sauce even better!
